Module org.tquadrat.foundation.svg
Package org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.type

Class SVGNumber

java.lang.Object
org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.type.SVGNumber
Direct Known Subclasses:
SVGNumber.SVGDegree, SVGNumber.SVGMillimeter, SVGNumber.SVGPercent, SVGNumber.SVGPixel, SVGNumber.SVGUserUnitValue
@ClassVersion(sourceVersion="$Id: SVGNumber.java 1139 2024-06-16 19:50:41Z tquadrat $") @API(status=STABLE, since="0.0.5") public sealed class SVGNumber extends Object permits SVGNumber.SVGDegree, SVGNumber.SVGMillimeter, SVGNumber.SVGPercent, SVGNumber.SVGPixel, SVGNumber.SVGUserUnitValue
A numeric type with a unit as used by various SVG attributes.
Author:
Thomas Thrien (thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org)
Version:
$Id: SVGNumber.java 1139 2024-06-16 19:50:41Z tquadrat $
Since:
0.0.5

    SVGNumber.SVGPixel
    An SVG pixel type.
    static final class 
    SVGNumber.SVGUserUnitValue
    An SVG user unit type; usually this is the same as SVGNumber.SVGPixel, but without a unit specifier.

  • Field Details

    • m_IsInteger

      private final boolean m_IsInteger
      Flag that indicates whether the type is an integer (int) - as in opposite to a double). There it does not matter that the decimal places of a double are effectively zero.

    • m_IsNegative

      private final boolean m_IsNegative
      Flag that indicates whether the type is a negative number.

    • isInteger

      public final boolean isInteger()
      Returns a flag that indicates whether the type is an integer (int) - as in opposite to a double). There it does not matter that the decimal places of a double are effectively zero.
      Returns:
      true if the type is an integer, false otherwise.

    • isNegative

      public final boolean isNegative()
      Returns a flag that indicates whether the type is a negative number.
      Returns:
      true if the type is less than zero, false otherwise.

    • isZero

      public final boolean isZero()
      Returns a flag that indicates whether the type is zero.
      Returns:
      true if the type is 0 (or 0.0), false otherwise.
